header.headertext: AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED IN COMMITTEE

text.quote: 000: Clause 1, page 1, line 5, at end insert—

“(1A) The Secretary of State must, in each of the tax years ending with 5 April 2014 and 5 April 2015, make an order by statutory instrument increasing each of the relevant sums by no less than the general level of prices over the period under review. For the meaning of the “relevant sums” see paragraph 3 of the Schedule.”
000: Clause 1, page 1, line 5, at end insert—

“(1B) The Secretary of State must, in each of the tax years ending with 5 April 2014 and 5 April 2015, make an order by statutory instrument increasing each of the relevant sums by no less than the general level of prices over the period under review. For the meaning of the “relevant sums” see paragraph 4 of the Schedule.”
000: Clause 3, page 2, line 38, at end insert—

“( ) Except that no commencement shall take effect until the Secretary of State is satisfied that legal help is available for all claimants who seek legal advice on the validity of the decision on their benefit entitlement.”
000: The Schedule, page 4, line 7, leave out paragraph (b)
000: The Schedule, page 4, leave out lines 24 to 33
000: The Schedule, page 4, line 37, leave out paragraph (a)
000: The Schedule, page 4, line 42, at end insert—
“3 The relevant amounts for the purposes of section 1, subsection (1A), are the sums—
text.IndentOne: (a) specified in regulations under section 8(3) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012;
(b) specified in regulations under section 9(2) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012;
(c) specified in regulations under section 10(3) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012;
(d) specified in regulations under section 12(3) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012.”

text.quote: 000: The Schedule, page 4, line 42, at end insert—
“4 The relevant amounts for the purposes of section 1, subsection (1B), are the sums—
text.IndentOne: (a) specified in paragraph 1 of Schedule 3 to the Housing Benefit Regulations 2006;

(b) specified in regulations in Schedule 2 to the Working Tax Credit (Entitlement and Maximum Rate) Regulations 2002 for the basic element, the 30 hour element, the second adult element and the lone parent element.”
